alert.note: Alert for Dundy (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 01 at 9:59PM CST until February 03 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM MST /MIDNIGHT CST/ WEDNESDAY TO 11 AM MST /NOON CST/ THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches, with locally higher accumulations possible. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Dundy County Nebraska, and Rawlins and Graham Counties in Kansas. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 8 PM MST /9 PM CST/ this evening to 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 11 PM MST /midnight CST/ Wednesday to 11 AM MST /noon CST/ Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions due to snowpacked roads and freezing temperatures. Patchy blowing snow could reduce visibility at times. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commutes. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
